Trails.Name: Lost in the Woods (Lower) Uphill Route
Lost in the Woods (Upper) Uphill Route

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Tuesday, February 17, 2026 2:45 PM Due to deep snow and storm conditions, all lift operations will be delayed to no earlier than 9:00AM Wednesday, February 18, with further delays likely. Main Lodge will be closed, with no lifts operating in that zone. Mammoth Mountain is currently CLOSED Tuesday, February 17. To change your reservation for today or tomorrow, please call 800.MAMMOTH. To cancel and request a refund, view our Online Cancelation Form. Rolling openings tomorrow morning will be limited to lower-mountain lifts out of Canyon and Eagle Lodges. We have received 31-45 inches of snow during this storm and counting. The mountain is experiencing gusts of 80+ MPH, with heavy snowfall and near zero temps. 
  
Upcoming Storm Cycle Expectations: Wednesday, February 18 expect a delayed start of no earlier than 9AM, with heavy snowfall and strong winds expected. Snowfall is forecast to taper off by the evening of Thursday, February 19, with sunny skies in the forecast this weekend. Please review our updated storm cycle procedure, new this year.   
Conditions: Heavy snowfall, strong SW winds, and near zero temps.  
Visibility: Heavy snowfall and gusty winds will contribute to low visibility conditions.  
Lift status: All lifts CLOSED for today, Tuesday, February 17. Wednesday, February 18, 8 lifts are expected to spin no earlier than 9:00 AM, with rolling openings to Roller Coaster Express (4), Chair 7, Chair 8, Eagle Express (15), Schoolyard Express (17), Chair 20, Chair 21, and the Village Gondola, conditions permitting. Further delays are likely. Lifts will not operate out of Main Lodge.  
Safety: Deep snow remains a serious factor. The risk of Snow Immersion Suffocation (SIS) is real, so avoid tree wells and deep snow near trees. Always ski or ride with a partner, keep your group in sight, and stay alert for obstacles beneath new snowfall. Visit our Safety page for more tips. Our on-mountain emergency hotline is: 760.934.0611
Road Conditions: Chains or snow tires are currently required. Heavy snowfall today is making roads snowy and icy. High winds may kick up light powder, reducing visibility. Consider taking the free Mountain Shuttle. If driving, please drive with caution and allow extra space. Check our Road Conditions page for the latest status.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport:
Deep Snow Safety: Stay within sight of your group, give trees plenty of space, and avoid riding solo. Obstacles may exist beneath new snow, so ski and ride with caution.
On-mountain emergency hotline: 760.934.0611
